intro: Phuopsis, commonly known as the false sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, often compound leaves and showy, butterfly-like flowers. They are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Phuopsis species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
